SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models

Class Ingredient

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models.Ingredient
All Implemented Interfaces:
FoodItem
public class Ingredient extends Object implements FoodItem
A class representing an ingredient.

Provides methods for getting the name, category, unit, and amount of an ingredient. Also provides a method for setting the amount of an ingredient.

The class implements the FoodItem interface, which provides methods for getting the name, category, and unit of a food item.

Since:
0.2
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

  • Constructor Details

    • Ingredient

      public Ingredient(String name, String category, String unit, double amount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a new ingredient with the provided name, category, unit, and amount.

      The method validates the provided parameters and initializes the ingredient with the provided values if they are all valid. If any of the provided String parameters are null or an empty string, or if the amount is negative or zero, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the ingredient
      category - the category of the ingredient
      unit - the unit of the ingredient
      amount - the amount of the ingredient
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the provided String parameters are null or an empty string, or if the amount is negative or zero.

    • setAmount

      public void setAmount(double amount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the amount of the ingredient.

      If the provided amount is less than or equal to zero, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, it sets the amount of the ingredient to the provided value.

      Parameters:
      amount - the new amount of the ingredient
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is less than or equal to zero.

    • toReadableString

      public String toReadableString()
      Returns a user-friendly string representation of the ingredient, in the format: "Name (Category): Amount Unit".
      Returns:
      a string representation of the ingredient. Including name, category, amount, and unit.
